intro: Pleurothallis nigrohirsuta, commonly known as the black-haired pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and green. The plant thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in the understory of forests. Its leaves are usually dark green and hairy, giving it its common name. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
